### Once upon a time there were two good boys

::: center
![Kobus and Piet!](KOenPIET.png){width="70%"}
:::

## 

### They were growing ...

```{r, echo=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)

kobus <- data.frame(weight = c(7.0, 8.1, 7.6,8.35, 9.8, 10.4), age_wk = c(15, 17, 18, 20, 24, 28)) 

kobus$weight <- kobus$weight * 1000

piet <- data.frame(weight = c(1268,1254,1315,1445,1575,1673,1753,1878,1968,2218,2526, 2762), date = c("19jul2025", "26jul2025","29jul2025","3aug2025","6aug2025","12aug2025","18aug2025", "25aug2025","30aug2025", "11sep2025","26sep2025", "10oct2025"))

piet$date <- as.Date(piet$date, "%d%b%Y")

piet$age_day <- piet$date - as.Date("5may2025","%d%b%Y")

piet$age_wk <- piet$age_day/7

piet$age_wk <- as.numeric(round(piet$age_wk))

twee_dieren <- bind_rows(
  kobus %>% mutate(who = "Kobus"),
  piet  %>% mutate(who = "Piet")
)
```

```{r}
library(DT)

# create interactive, sortable table
datatable(
  twee_dieren,
  options = list(
    pageLength = 7,   # how many rows shown at once
    autoWidth = TRUE   # auto-adjust column widths
  ),
  rownames = FALSE
)
```

## ... and growing ...

```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)

# base ggplot
p <- ggplot(twee_dieren, aes(x = age_wk, y = weight, color = who)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(
    title = "Growth Curves Kobus en Piet",
    x = "Age (weeks)",
    y = "Weight (gram)",
    color = "who"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

# make it interactive
ggplotly(p)
```

## 
### The harder their search for food, the cuter they are ...
... and the more I love them ! Which I will show using the plot that I made with this code

```{r, echo=T,results='hide', eval=FALSE}
x <- seq(0, 10, length.out = 100)
y <- exp(x / 3)

ggplot(data.frame(x, y), aes(x, y)) +
  geom_line(color = "red", size = 1.5) +
  labs(
    x = "My love for Ko and Piet",
    y = "How hungry they are \n / How cute they look to get food",
    title = "Love versus hunger"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 16)
```
